metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5195 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high
metadata.Description:
Race condition in mm/gup.c in the Linux kernel 2.x through 4.x before 4.8.3allows local users to gain privileges by leveraging incorrect handling of acopy-on-write (COW) feature to write to a read-only memory mapping, asexploited in the wild in October 2016, aka "Dirty COW."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5195` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-45.66
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-45.66
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-45.66
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1029-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1029.36
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1032-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1032.36
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-45.66').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1029.36').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1032.36').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
